channel.title: Object
channel.description: Hi again, I Want Add Objects I Know How But I dont Have [code]public void NewObject [/code] Is There Any Other Way To Add.

item.title: Object
item.dc:creator: @BORED BORED
item.description:
@BORED wrote:

omg this server ‘‘sucks’’.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 05, 2008, 11:59:18 AM[/size][hr]i need to type it ? i cant make a copy[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 05, 2008, 12:08:37 PM[/size][hr]i removed this public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){ if(p != null){ client person = (client)p; if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){ if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){ person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);}}}}} public void NewObjects() { makeGlobalObject(3492, 3493, 4032, 0, 10); }

but now i cant add objects!! :@[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 05, 2008, 12:11:54 PM[/size][hr]ill download rickscape or somthing

item.title: Object
item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice
item.description:
@Zombiedevice wrote:

Search for this in client.java:

makeGlobalObject

Then just copy and paste one of those and change the ID’s around.

EDIT: Lol, delta beat me too it. I was posting and it said that a post just came in.

Read full topic

item.title: Object
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Add these in client.java

public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){ if(p != null){ client person = (client)p; if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){ if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){ person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);}}}}} public void NewObjects() { makeGlobalObject(xxxx, yyyy, id, 0, 10); }
Replace xxxx and yyyy with the x and y coords of the object. Replace the id with the object id
then find case 121: and in there add
NewObjects();

Read full topic
